content.value:
Barcelona – more than just beautiful beaches,
antique Catalan districts, and scenic mountains. We are Spain’s vibrant digital
technology hub! With over 1,300 startups, Barcelona has developed into Southern
Europe’s startup ecosystem number one, with a large percentage of mobile and
software technology ventures. Of course, having the proper coding skills in
this environment is of vital importance. This is where TechLabs Barcelona comes
into practice: Rooted in Sant Cugat’s ESADE Business School, we help students
from all backgrounds to make their first coding experiences or to deepen their
existing knowledge in Artificial Intelligence, Data Science or Web Development.

. At the same time, we take a bridging function to connect them
with the pulsing community of Barcelona’s tech scene with our meetups and
workshops throughout the semester.

At the beginning, there were five motivated
tech enthusiasts, who believed in the concept of TechLabs and were eager to
bring it to their local university. This set the cornerstone for the second
TechLabs location after Muenster. After officially founding TechLabs Barcelona
as an ESADE student association, the recruiting of the first batch began. We
were overwhelmed with the large interest on campus and happy to welcome over 50
students to our first semester. Over the course of six months, our students kept
making impressive progress in their online courses, while working on their
hands-on coding projects for the Digital Shaper Program. Further, we enjoyed
regular meetups where we developed our skills, exchanged views about tech
topics, or just socialized over a few beers: A prototyping workshop with Le
Wagon, a visit of the Super Computer Mare Nostrum, ESADE’s famous campus party…
the list is long! We are very excited for our future semesters in Barcelona and
cannot wait to further grow and develop our local Catalan community.
